row.name: Decipher Writing
row.comment: You attempt to decipher complicated writing or literature on an obscure topic.

row.name: EARN INCOME
row.comment: You use one of your skills to make money during downtime.

row.name: IDENTIFY MAGIC
row.comment: Once you discover that an item, location, or ongoing effect is magical, you can spend 10 minutes to try to identify the particulars of its magic.

row.name: LEARN A SPELL
row.comment: You can gain access to a new spell of your tradition from someone who knows that spell or from magical writing like a spellbook or scroll.

row.name: RECALL KNOWLEDGE
row.comment: The following skills can be used to Recall Knowledge, getting information about the listed topics.

row.name: SUBSIST
row.comment: You try to provide food and shelter for yourself, and possibly others as well, with a standard of living.

row.name: BALANCE
row.comment: You move across a narrow surface or uneven ground.

row.name: TUMBLE THROUGH
row.comment: You Stride up to your Speed. During this movement, you can try to move through the space of one enemy.

row.name: MANEUVER IN FLIGHT
row.comment: You try a difficult maneuver while flying.

row.name: SQUEEZE
row.comment: You contort yourself to squeeze through a space so small you can barely fit through.

row.name: BORROW AN ARCANE SPELL
row.comment: If you’re an arcane spellcaster who prepares from a spellbook, you can attempt to prepare a spell from someone else’s spellbook.

row.name: CLIMB
row.comment: You move up, down, or across an incline.

row.name: FORCE OPEN
row.comment: Using your body, a lever, or some other tool, you attempt to forcefully open a door, window, container or heavy gate. With a high enough result, you can even smash through walls.

row.name: GRAPPLE
row.comment: You attempt to grab a creature or object with your free hand.

row.name: HIGH JUMP
row.comment: You Stride, then make a vertical Leap.

row.name: LONG JUMP
row.comment: You Stride, then make a horizontal Leap.

row.name: SHOVE
row.comment: You push a creature away from you.

row.name: SWIM
row.comment: You propel yourself through water.

row.name: TRIP
row.comment: You try to knock a creature to the ground.

row.name: DISARM
row.comment: You try to knock something out of a creature’s grasp.

row.name: REPAIR
row.comment: You spend 10 minutes attempting to fix a damaged item, placing the item on a stable surface and using the repair kit with both hands.

row.name: CRAFT
row.comment: You can make an item from raw materials.

row.name: IDENTIFY ALCHEMY
row.comment: You can identify the nature of an alchemical item with 10 minutes of testing using alchemist’s tools.

row.name: CREATE A DIVERSION
row.comment: With a gesture, a trick, or some distracting words, you can create a diversion that draws creatures’ attention elsewhere.

row.name: IMPERSONATE
row.comment: You create a disguise to pass yourself off as someone or something you are not.

row.name: LIE
row.comment: You try to fool someone with an untruth.

row.name: FEINT
row.comment: With a misleading flourish, you leave an opponent unprepared for your real attack.

row.name: GATHER INFORMATION
row.comment: You canvass local markets, taverns, and gathering places in an attempt to learn about a specific individual or topic.

row.name: MAKE AN IMPRESSION
row.comment: With at least 1 minute of conversation, during which you engage in charismatic overtures, flattery, and other acts of goodwill, you seek to make a good impression on someone to make them temporarily agreeable.

row.name: REQUEST
row.comment: You can make a request of a creature that’s friendly or helpful to you. You must couch the request in terms that the target would accept given their current attitude toward you.

row.name: COERCE
row.comment: With threats either veiled or overt, you attempt to bully a creature into doing what you want. You must spend at least 1 minute of conversation with a creature you can see and that can either see or sense you.

row.name: DEMORALIZE
row.comment: With a sudden shout, a well-timed taunt, or a cutting putdown, you can shake an enemy’s resolve.

row.name: ADMINISTER FIRST AID
row.comment: You perform first aid on an adjacent creature that is dying or bleeding.

row.name: TREAT DISEASE
row.comment: You spend at least 8 hours caring for a diseased creature.

row.name: TREAT POISON
row.comment: You treat a patient to prevent the spread of poison.

row.name: TREAT WOUNDS
row.comment: You spend 10 minutes treating one injured living creature.

row.name: COMMAND AN ANIMAL
row.comment: You issue an order to an animal.

row.name: PERFORM
row.comment: When making a brief performance—one song, a quick dance, or a few jokes.

row.name: CREATE FORGERY
row.comment: You create a forged document, usually over the course of a day or a week.

row.name: CONCEAL AN OBJECT
row.comment: You hide a small object on your person (such as a weapon of light Bulk).

row.name: HIDE
row.comment: You huddle behind cover or greater cover or deeper into concealment to become hidden, rather than observed.

row.name: SNEAK
row.comment: You can attempt to move to another place while becoming or staying undetected.

row.name: SENSE DIRECTION
row.comment: Using the stars, the position of the sun, traits of the geography or flora, or the behavior of fauna, you can stay oriented in the wild.

row.name: COVER TRACKS
row.comment: You cover your tracks, moving up to half your travel Speed.

row.name: TRACK
row.comment: You follow tracks, moving at up to half your travel Speed.

row.name: PALM AN OBJECT
row.comment: Palming a small, unattended object without being noticed

row.name: STEAL
row.comment: You try to take a small object from another creature without being noticed.

row.name: DISABLE A DEVICE
row.comment: This action allows you to disarm a trap or another complex device.

row.name: PICK A LOCK
row.comment: Opening a lock without a key

row.name: Grab an Edge
row.comment: reduce the damage from some falls

row.name: Aid
row.prereqDetails: An ally is about to use an action that requires a skill check or attack roll. The ally is willing to accept your aid, and you have prepared to help
row.comment: You try to help your ally with a task. To use this reaction, you must first prepare to help, usually by using an action during your turn. You must explain to the GM exactly how you’re trying to help, and they determine whether you can Aid your ally.
row.duration: for preparing aid: usually by using an action during your turn
row.calculations: roll = roll of trigger or decided by the GM

row.name: Crawl
row.comment: You move 5 feet by crawling and continue to stay prone.

row.name: Delay
row.comment: You wait for the right moment to act. The rest of your turn doesn’t happen yet. Instead, you’re removed from the initiative order. You can return to the initiative order as a free action triggered by the end of any other creature’s turn. This permanently changes your initiative to the new position. You can’t use reactions until you return to the initiative order.

row.name: Escape
row.comment: You attempt to escape from being grabbed, immobilized, or restrained. Choose one creature, object, spell effect, hazard, or other impediment imposing any of those conditions on you.
row.dc: {grabbing: athletics; tied up: thievery} dc or spell dc or dc of impediment

row.name: Interact
row.comment: You use your hand or hands to manipulate an object or the terrain. You can grab an unattended or stored object, open a door, or produce some similar effect. You might have to attempt a skill check to determine if your Interact action was successful.

row.name: Leap
row.comment: You take a careful, short jump.
row.calculations: horizontal distance on elevated surface, feet = 5

row.name: Ready
row.comment: You prepare to use an action that will occur outside your turn. Choose a single action or free action you can use, and designate a trigger. Your turn then ends. If the trigger you designated occurs before the start of your next turn, you can use the chosen action as a reaction (provided you still meet the requirements to use it). You can’t Ready a free action that already has a trigger.

row.name: Release
row.comment: You release something you’re holding in your hand or hands. This might mean dropping an item, removing one hand from your weapon while continuing to hold it in another hand, releasing a rope suspending a chandelier, or performing a similar action.

row.name: Seek
row.comment: You scan an area for signs of creatures or objects. If you’re looking for creatures, choose an area you’re scanning.
The GM might determine you need to Seek as an activity, taking more actions or even minutes or hours if you’re searching a particularly cluttered area.

row.name: Sense motive
row.comment: You try to tell whether a creature’s behavior is abnormal. Choose one creature, and assess it for odd body language, signs of nervousness, and other indicators that it might be trying to deceive someone. You typically can’t try to Sense the Motive of the same creature again until the situation changes significantly.
row.dc: (deception dc of creature) or (dc of spell affecting target) or (dc from gm)

row.name: Stand
row.comment: You stand up from prone.

row.name: Step
row.comment: You carefully move 5 feet. Unlike most types of movement, Stepping doesn’t trigger reactions, such as Attacks of Opportunity, that can be triggered by move actions or upon leaving or entering a square.

row.name: Stride
row.comment: You move up to your Speed.

row.name: Melee strike
row.comment: You attack with a weapon you’re wielding or with an unarmed attack, targeting one creature within your reach.

row.name: Ranged strike
row.comment: You attack with a weapon you’re wielding or with an unarmed attack, targeting one creature within your range.

row.name: Take cover
row.comment: You press yourself against a wall or duck behind an obstacle to take better advantage of cover

row.name: Arrest a fall
row.comment: You attempt an Acrobatics check to slow your fall.

row.name: Avert gaze
row.comment: You avert your gaze from danger.

row.name: Burrow
row.comment: You dig your way through dirt, sand, or a similar loose material at a rate up to your burrow Speed.

row.name: Fly
row.comment: You move through the air up to your fly Speed. If you’re airborne at the end of your turn and did not use a Fly action this round, you fall.
row.calculations: distance = fly speed * {on the same level: 1; to hover in place: 0; to the ground: 2; upward: difficult terrain}

row.name: Grab the edge
row.comment: When you fall off or past an edge or other handhold, you can try to grab it, potentially stopping your fall.
row.checkCriticalSuccess: Grab the edge with critical success
row.checkCriticalFailure: Grab the edge with critical failure

row.name: Mount
row.comment: You move onto the creature and ride it.

row.name: Dismount
row.comment: If you’re already mounted, you can instead use this action to dismount, moving off the mount into a space adjacent to it.

row.name: Point out
row.comment: You indicate a creature that you can see to one or more allies, gesturing in a direction and describing the distance verbally.

row.name: Raise a shield
row.comment: You position your shield to protect yourself.

row.name: Avoid notice
row.comment: You attempt a Stealth check to avoid notice while traveling

row.name: Defend
row.comment: You move at half your travel speed with your shield raised.

row.name: Detect magic
row.comment: You cast detect magic at regular intervals.

row.name: Follow the expert
row.comment: The ally must be at least an expert in that skill and must be willing to provide assistance. While Following the Expert, you match their tactic or attempt similar skill checks. Thanks to your ally’s assistance, you can add your level as a proficiency bonus to the associated skill check, even if you’re untrained.

row.name: Hustle
row.comment: You strain yourself to move at double your travel speed.

row.name: Investigate
row.comment: You seek out information about your surroundings.

row.name: Repeat a spell
row.comment: You repeatedly cast the same spell.

row.name: Scout
row.comment: You scout ahead and behind the group to watch danger.

row.name: Search
row.comment: You Seek meticulously for hidden doors, concealed hazards, and so on. In locations with many objects to search, you have to stop and spend significantly longer to search thoroughly

row.name: Rest
row.comment: You perform at your best when you take enough time to rest and prepare. Once every 24 hours, you can take a period of rest.

row.name: Daily preparations
row.calculations: uses per day for feats = maximum value
